content:
• Wednesday, August 17, 2011
  • NTAP

    Departing NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP) CFO Steve Gomo attributes the company's weak top-line results and...

    Departing NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP) CFO Steve Gomo attributes the company's weak top-line results and guidance to a "fairly dramatic slowdown in the last three weeks of July," with particular weakness among federal and financial customers. Though none can match NetApp's 11.8% decline, a variety of enterprise tech names are now trading lower AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:08 PM
  • ISS

    Chinese IT services firm iSoftStone (NYSE:ISS) gained 4.8% today after reporting Q2 revenue of...

    Chinese IT services firm iSoftStone (NYSE:ISS) gained 4.8% today after reporting Q2 revenue of $67M (+49.4%) and EPS of $0.13, beating consensus by $5.2M and $0.01. Gross margin rose to 36.1% from 33.2% in the year-ago period. The company raised its 2011 revenue guidance to $284M from $277M, and its EPS guidance to $0.57 from $0.55.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • QTRH

    Canadian technology licensing company Wi-LAN (WILN) announces that it intends to make a formal...

    Canadian technology licensing company Wi-LAN (WILN) announces that it intends to make a formal all-cash offer to acquire MOSAID Technologies (OTC:MBTHF) for approximately C$480 million. WILN -9.8% AH. (PR).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • CREE

    Cree (NASDAQ:CREE) is acquiring Ruud Lighting, a maker of outdoor LED lighting products, for...

    Cree (NASDAQ:CREE) is acquiring Ruud Lighting, a maker of outdoor LED lighting products, for $525M in cash and stock. Following the acquisition, which Cree expects to be accretive to non-GAAP FY12 earnings, the company expects FQ1 2012 EPS to be at the low end of its prior guidance range of $0.25-$0.28. CREE -4.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • CACI

    CACI International (NYSE:CACI): FQ4 EPS of $1.44 beats by $0.27. Revenues of $963M (+13.5% Y/Y)...

    CACI International (NYSE:CACI): FQ4 EPS of $1.44 beats by $0.27. Revenues of $963M (+13.5% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Expects FY12 revenue of $3.75B to $3.95B and EPS of $4.70 to $4.90 vs. revenue estimates of $3.84B and EPS of $4.67. Shares +7.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM | 1 Comment

  • More on Limited Brands' Q2 report: Issues Q3 EPS guidance of $0.17-$0.22 vs. $0.18 consensus,...

    More on Limited Brands' Q2 report: Issues Q3 EPS guidance of $0.17-$0.22 vs. $0.18 consensus, and sets FY11 EPS guidance to $2.35-$2.50 vs. $2.26 consensus. Expects August comparable store sales to increase in the high single digit range vs. previous estimate of low single digit range. Shares +3.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • VIAV

    More on JDS Uniphase's (JDSU) FQ4 results: Growth driven by 28.6% Y/Y increase in Optical...

    More on JDS Uniphase's (JDSU) FQ4 results: Growth driven by 28.6% Y/Y increase in Optical Products revenue, hurt by 7.5% decline in Advanced Optical Technologies. Company expects FQ1 2012 revenue of $400M-$425M, below $470.3M consensus. Reports seeing "macroeconomic challenges and inventory corrections." JDSU now -2.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • SNPS

    More on Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS): FQ3 beats across-the-board on a 32% jump in profits as demand...

    More on Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS): FQ3 beats across-the-board on a 32% jump in profits as demand remains strong for mobile devices, cloud infrastructure and electronic products. Top-line revenues also benefited from recent acquisitions and a slew of licensing agreements already put in place. Shares +2.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • SNPS

    More on Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS) FQ3 results: Revenue increased 14% Y/Y. Sees FQ4 revenue at...

    More on Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS) FQ3 results: Revenue increased 14% Y/Y. Sees FQ4 revenue at $386M-$392M, EPS at $0.44-$0.46. Sees full-year revenue at $1.531B-$1.537B, EPS at $1.79-$1.81, cash flow from operations greater than $400M. Shares +1.9% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM

  • ValueAct Capital reports taking a 5.3% stake in VeriSign. Shares +1.2% AH.

    ValueAct Capital reports taking a 5.3% stake in VeriSign. Shares +1.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • NTAP

    More on NetApp's (NASDAQ:NTAP) FQ1 results: Gross margin was 61.5%, down from 65% in the prior...

    More on NetApp's (NASDAQ:NTAP) FQ1 results: Gross margin was 61.5%, down from 65% in the prior quarter and 64% in the year-ago quarter. NetApp's revenue and gross margin weakness will lead to concerns of EMC's VNX platform, introduced earlier this year and aimed at NetApp, hurting the company's sales and causing price pressure. NTAP -12% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • NTAP

    More on NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP): company announces the retirement of CFO Steve Gomo effective...

    More on NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP): company announces the retirement of CFO Steve Gomo effective December 31. Shares -11.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • SNPS

    Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS): FQ3 EPS of $0.46 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $387M (+15% Y/Y) beats by...

    Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS): FQ3 EPS of $0.46 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $387M (+15% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares +2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • PETM

    More on PetSmart (NASDAQ:PETM) Q2 results: Comparable store sales increased 5% Y/Y, $63M of...

    More on PetSmart (NASDAQ:PETM) Q2 results: Comparable store sales increased 5% Y/Y, $63M of stock repurchased. Sees 3QFY11 comparable store sales growth at 3%-4%, EPS at $0.41-$0.45. Sees FY11 comparable store sales growth in low to mid-single digit, Total sales to increase in mid-single digit. Raises EPS guidance to $2.40-$2.48 from $2.32-$2.40. Shares -3.7% AH. (PR).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • NTAP

    NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP): FQ1 EPS of $0.55 in-line. Revenue of $1.46B (+26% Y/Y) misses by $62M....

    NetApp (NASDAQ:NTAP): FQ1 EPS of $0.55 in-line. Revenue of $1.46B (+26% Y/Y) misses by $62M. Blames shortfall on "challenging macroeconomic environment." Company expects FQ2 EPS of $0.58-$0.62, in-line with $0.60 consensus. Expects revenue of $1.5B-$1.6B, below $1.62B consensus. NTAP -10.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • VIAV

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU): FQ4 EPS of $0.23 in-line. Revenue of $472M (+21% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Sees...

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU): FQ4 EPS of $0.23 in-line. Revenue of $472M (+21% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Sees 1QFY12 Revenue at $400M-$425M. Shares -6.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • WCN

    Progressive Waste Solutions (BIN) gains 6.9% on volume 2X normal activity after announcing...

    Progressive Waste Solutions (BIN) gains 6.9% on volume 2X normal activity after announcing a share buyback program for up to 4M shares in the next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • SNPS

    Synopsys (SNPS +3.9%) trades higher into the close with its FQ3 results due after-hours. Analyst...

    Synopsys (SNPS +3.9%) trades higher into the close with its FQ3 results due after-hours. Analyst estimates are for earnings of $0.43 per share on $382M in revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • CNK

    Cinemark (CNK +3.4%) holds on to gains late in the day after Lazard Capital upgraded the shares...

    Cinemark (CNK +3.4%) holds on to gains late in the day after Lazard Capital upgraded the shares earlier to buy on valuation, citing an improved outlook for international cinema.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • DRIV-OLD

    Digital River (DRIV-OLD -7.8%) is cut to Underweight at Morgan Stanley on concerns that its...

    Digital River (DRIV-OLD -7.8%) is cut to Underweight at Morgan Stanley on concerns that its software and gaming segments "are becoming less relevant due to a structural shift in distribution to app stores where DRIV has limited presence." Weak traction in the consumer electronics space and dependence on Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) are also cited as concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • PPC

    Shares of Pilgrim's Pride (PPC -4.7%) are down after S&P lowered its junk-level rating on...

    Shares of Pilgrim's Pride (PPC -4.7%) are down after S&P lowered its junk-level rating on the poultry producer late yesterday, saying results this year will continue to be impacted by higher feed costs and weak U.S. pricing.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • PLUS

    Shares of thinly-traded ePlus (PLUS +9.1%) move higher after its board authorizes a 500K share...

    Shares of thinly-traded ePlus (PLUS +9.1%) move higher after its board authorizes a 500K share stock buyback over the next 12-months, commencing on September 16.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • UNIS

    Unilife (UNIS +13%) continues to rise after its CEO announced earlier that he intends to buy up...

    Unilife (UNIS +13%) continues to rise after its CEO announced earlier that he intends to buy up to $1M in stock. Chief Executive Alan Shortall says he will buy $500K this week, and the remaining $500K through September 30.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • CARB

    Shares of Carbonite (CARB -11.4%) remain unsettled after the timing of its IPO last week left a...

    Shares of Carbonite (CARB -11.4%) remain unsettled after the timing of its IPO last week left a little bit to be desired. The firm still looks to the future, announcing a cloud backup partnership with Drobo to provide data protection for small businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • BCSI

    Blue Coat (NASDAQ:BCSI) is now down 23.7% after reporting weak FQ1 results and announcing the...

    Blue Coat (NASDAQ:BCSI) is now down 23.7% after reporting weak FQ1 results and announcing the departure of its CEO. Lazard, which had voiced concerns 2 weeks ago, is cutting its rating to Sell, believing "execution issues are intensifying" and macro problems also exist. Needam is cutting the company to Hold, believing a buyout is now less likely.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • REGN

    Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN -4.7%) shares are lower after the FDA pushes back its review for...

    Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN -4.7%) shares are lower after the FDA pushes back its review for the company's eye drug Eylea by three months. BofA Merrill Lynch cut its rating on the news, saying the extension leaves the stock with "minimal upside potential."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • TUDO

    Though rival Tudou (NASDAQ:TUDO) is down 7% from its IPO price on its first trading day,...

    Though rival Tudou (NASDAQ:TUDO) is down 7% from its IPO price on its first trading day, Youku.com (NYSE:YOKU) is up 8.3%, as a Chinese news site reports Internet giant Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY) is interested in taking a stake in the company, and making Youku its online video provider.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • INTU

    Shares of Intuit (INTU -2.5%) trade lower in advance of tomorrow's earnings report. Analysts...

    Shares of Intuit (INTU -2.5%) trade lower in advance of tomorrow's earnings report. Analysts weighing in on the firm: BofA maintains a Buy rating, seeing INTU as one of the best-positioned in the sector to face a recession. Barclays trims its PT on shares to $54, from $56, and keeps an Overweight rating in place.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • T

    Shareholder Pentwater Capital takes steps to block MHR Capital from taking over Leap Wireless...

    Shareholder Pentwater Capital takes steps to block MHR Capital from taking over Leap Wireless (LEAP +4.9%). In a letter to the the pre-paid carrier's board, Pentwater is requesting a rule be instituted preventing anyone from buying more than 27.5% equity without approval of the shareholders.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • NOK

    Quck take on InterDigital: Nokia seems an unlikely suitor; it already has a strong patent...

    Quck take on InterDigital: Nokia seems an unlikely suitor; it already has a strong patent portfolio, and acquiring InterDigital would consume much of its cash position. But Qualcomm is an intriguing candidate; it has plenty of cash, and could use InterDigital's 4G patents to boost its royalty rate on 4G phones, which is below its rate on 3G phones.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • GOOG

    After falling hard on Monday following GOOG/MMI, InterDigital (IDCC +6.8%) is up today as Nokia...

    After falling hard on Monday following GOOG/MMI, InterDigital (IDCC +6.8%) is up today as Nokia (NYSE:NOK) and Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) reportedly join Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) and Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) in weighing bids for the company. Google hasn't formally withdrawn its interest, but it's unclear whether it will still make a bid. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • CRM

    Tech has been the heaviest drag on today's trade, particularly cloud stocks such as...

    Tech has been the heaviest drag on today's trade, particularly cloud stocks such as Salesforce.com (CRM -6.1%), Citrix (CTXS -3.3%) and Red Hat (RHT -3.2%), after Oppenheimer lowers its estimates and price targets for the broader group “to reflect the slowing worldwide economy," adding that software firms “are often the last impacted" by a weaker economy.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • SKUL

    Music headphone maker Skullcandy (SKUL -2.9%) posted a strong Q2 on double-digit growth in the...

    Music headphone maker Skullcandy (SKUL -2.9%) posted a strong Q2 on double-digit growth in the U.S. and abroad, but the stock is trading lower after the company reduces its FY11 estimates without clearly explaining why.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANF

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -8.9%) is one of the S&P 500's biggest losers today, despite...

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -8.9%) is one of the S&P 500's biggest losers today, despite reporting a solid Q2. Gross margins dropped due to hyper-competitive markdowns (or perhaps it was the cash payout offered to Jersey Shore's Mike "The Situation" Sorrentino to get him to stop wearing its clothes), plus management made comments about the possibility of a double-dip recession hurting sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • CTRN

    Urban apparel retailer Citi Trends (CTRN -9.3%) trades lower after its Q2 loss widened sharply,...

    Urban apparel retailer Citi Trends (CTRN -9.3%) trades lower after its Q2 loss widened sharply, hit by slumping sales and heavy markdowns. Same-store sales dropped 12%, deeper than analysts' expectations for 11%. Not surprisingly, the company lowers FY11 guidance and cuts back on new store openings.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • MKTX

    MarketAxess Holdings (NASDAQ:MKTX) registers a 14.1% gain on volume 5X normal activity...

    MarketAxess Holdings (NASDAQ:MKTX) registers a 14.1% gain on volume 5X normal activity after a WSJ report says Bloomberg and Sungard are two potential bidders showing interest in the electronic trading firm. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • TNC

    Tennant (TNC +3.7%) gains after S&P says the firm will replace Gerber Scientific (GRB -0.1%)...

    Tennant (TNC +3.7%) gains after S&P says the firm will replace Gerber Scientific (GRB -0.1%) in the S&P SmallCap 600 Index. Another new addition to the index, iRobot (IRBT +5.1%), is also moving higher with the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR) rocks a 19% gain after the firm's CEO goes on a $5M buying spree of stock. With...

    Clearwire (CLWR) rocks a 19% gain after the firm's CEO goes on a $5M buying spree of stock. With CLWR's average daily trading volume standing at only 6.7M shares, the insider buying accounts for a significant portion of trading activity over the last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • TZOO

    Travelzoo (TZOO -12.3%) is adding to yesterday's losses after Jim Cramer took a bearish stance...

    Travelzoo (TZOO -12.3%) is adding to yesterday's losses after Jim Cramer took a bearish stance on the company during Monday's broadcast of Mad Money, noting its weak Q2 results. Travelzoo shares are now down over 64% from their April high of $103.80.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • FSLR

    Solar stocks (TAN -2.3%) move lower, as the sector continues its strong propensity to gain or...

    Solar stocks (TAN -2.3%) move lower, as the sector continues its strong propensity to gain or slump together. Today's decline was kicked off when First Solar (FSLR -5.1%) lost its Conviction Buy tag from Goldman and a key exec. Losers: TSL -4.6%, LDK -1.4%, JASO -1.4%, YGE -3.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAL

    Shares of US Airways (LCC -3.4%) lag other airline stocks (FAA +1.3%) after the firm's CEO...

    Shares of US Airways (LCC -3.4%) lag other airline stocks (FAA +1.3%) after the firm's CEO points out labor problems could drag on for years. The carrier expects to land a contract with flight attendants, but an agreement with pilots is unlikely until a seniority dispute - currently mired in court - is settled.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM

  • Hain Celestial Group (HAIN +5.5%) jumps on a valuation upgrade from RBC, saying the company's...

    Hain Celestial Group (HAIN +5.5%) jumps on a valuation upgrade from RBC, saying the company's top-line growth is "too compelling to ignore." Despite economic uncertainty, growth is actually re-accelerating in the natural and organic food category, and Hain is benefiting, the firm says.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • JKHY

    Shares of Jack Henry & Associates (JKHY +4.5%) gain after the payments processor reports Q2...

    Shares of Jack Henry & Associates (JKHY +4.5%) gain after the payments processor reports Q2 revenue of $249M (+9% Y/Y), and beats consensus EPS estimates by $0.02. The firm's CEO says he sees the spending environment for customers as continuing to improve even in a down economy. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • TUDO

    Chinese video website Tudou (TUDO -12.1%) falls in initial trading following a $180M IPO that...

    Chinese video website Tudou (TUDO -12.1%) falls in initial trading following a $180M IPO that valued the company at $822M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • PLX

    Protalix BioTherapeutics (PLX +6%) pops after the FDA accepts a resubmitted new drug application...

    Protalix BioTherapeutics (PLX +6%) pops after the FDA accepts a resubmitted new drug application for its experimental drug taliglucerase alfa, which is being developed to treat a rare genetic ailment called Gaucher's disease.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • TAOM

    Taomee (NYSE:TAOM), an operator of Chinese online media sites aimed at children, is down 15.5%...

    Taomee (NYSE:TAOM), an operator of Chinese online media sites aimed at children, is down 15.5% after reporting Q2 revenue of $11.8M (+23% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.14, beating consensus by $0.5M and $0.02. However, the company's forecast of 3-5% Q/Q growth is below consensus, and it expects EPS to decline due to higher SG&A and R&D expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • FLO

    Flowers Foods (FLO -8.9%) takes a hit after its Q2 EPS dips 16% on higher-than-anticipated...

    Flowers Foods (FLO -8.9%) takes a hit after its Q2 EPS dips 16% on higher-than-anticipated acquisition charges and a decline in sales growth due to rising commodity prices. The baked goods company also cuts FY11 guidance, as increasing packaging and shipping costs cut into margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) is down 5.2% after disclosing the head of its Utility Systems Business...

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) is down 5.2% after disclosing the head of its Utility Systems Business Group will be leaving. Utility sales are seen as a major growth opportunity for First Solar, whose panels aren't ideal for residential deployments. Meanwhile, Goldman is removing the company from its Conviction Buy list, citing "near-term uncertainty" in solar.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD -6.3%) is amazing at "squeezing water from the stone," as evidenced by its strong...

    Dell (DELL-OLD -6.3%) is amazing at "squeezing water from the stone," as evidenced by its strong earnings (also), but at some point, you must make products that people want. The company lowers its 2012 revenue outlook, and Doug McIntyre thinks it's more than a one-year problem: "Dell has not delivered products that have stirred any demand in the new tablet and smartphone markets."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • AIXXF

    Deutsche downgrades Aixtron (AIXG) to Hold from Buy, expecting the German tech concern to see an...

    Deutsche downgrades Aixtron (AIXG) to Hold from Buy, expecting the German tech concern to see an 11% guidance miss this year combined with a small revenue decline for FY12. Shares -8.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • EQNR

    Statoil (STO) continues higher following yesterday's 2.6% gain on news of a major oil discovery....

    Statoil (STO) continues higher following yesterday's 2.6% gain on news of a major oil discovery. Shares +4.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • VHC

    Shares of VirnetX (NYSEMKT:VHC) are up 4.4% premarket as tech firms with attractive patent...

    Shares of VirnetX (NYSEMKT:VHC) are up 4.4% premarket as tech firms with attractive patent portfolios (I, II) continue to gain more attention from investors. The firm's 4G internet security patents caught Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) eye in July, prompting AAPL to file a re-examination process with the USPTO.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • PLAB

    Photronics (NASDAQ:PLAB), a maker of photomasks for chip manufacturing, is up 6.1% premarket...

    Photronics (NASDAQ:PLAB), a maker of photomasks for chip manufacturing, is up 6.1% premarket after reporting FQ3 sales of $135.9M (+21% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.23, beating consensus by $4.1M and $0.04. Revenue was boosted by 24% Q/Q increase in sales of high-end integrated circuit photomasks, to $34.9M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • KODK

    Kodak (EK) is getting a serious look from investors after a report emerges saying the firm may...

    Kodak (EK) is getting a serious look from investors after a report emerges saying the firm may hold patents worth 5X more than the value of the firm itself. MDB Capital calls EK the "low-hanging fruit" and values the patents at $3B after assessing a tech premium similar to the Google/MMI markup. Shares +14.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM | 2 Comments
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD) is down 7.3% premarket after providing soft revenue figures in its FQ2 results...

    Dell (DELL-OLD) is down 7.3% premarket after providing soft revenue figures in its FQ2 results and FQ3 guidance. Weak PC shipments and declining government sales took their toll, as did a major decline in EMC reseller revenue. A 4% decline in sales to the Americas (offsetting strong Asian growth) also isn't going down well. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM
  • SPLS

    Shares of Staples (NASDAQ:SPLS) soar 10.2% premarket after the firm records an earnings beat and...

    Shares of Staples (NASDAQ:SPLS) soar 10.2% premarket after the firm records an earnings beat and raises guidance for FY11 EPS. Rival Office Depot (NYSE:ODP) is up 6.3%, apparently in sympathy, following its own report yesterday it beat analyst estimates on a wider loss from last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • TGT

    More on Target's (NYSE:TGT) Q2 report: Improved risk measures helped drive down receivables...

    More on Target's (NYSE:TGT) Q2 report: Improved risk measures helped drive down receivables -12.4% (Y/Y) and bad debt expenses -89% (Y/Y). Takes $36M charge in expenses and depreciation related to planned Canadian market entry in 2013. Shares +5.2% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM
  • TGT

    Target (NYSE:TGT): Q2 EPS of $1.03 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $16.24B (+4.6% Y/Y) beats by $90M....

    Target (NYSE:TGT): Q2 EPS of $1.03 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $16.24B (+4.6% Y/Y) beats by $90M. Sees Q3 EPS of $0.70-$0.75, FY11 EPS of $4.15-4.30. Shares +4.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM
